Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2011 06:37AM lc1975 wrote: Thank you!  I will be sure to wear sweatpants!  I will have the one with the dye.  It is nice to know what to expect going in.  Thanks again :)
Posts.Title: Made it through first MRI ginarn lc1975

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2011 06:50AM lc1975 wrote: I received my final pathology report.  My BS said that it is a little bit of everythying (benign) all in one spot!  They are calling it a sclerosing adenosis with papillomas, forming cysts, and hyperplasia.  In February I go for a baseline MRI and ultrasound and we will be monitoring after that.  Thank you everyone for your support!
Posts.Title: Made it through first MRI ginarn lc1975

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2011 06:03AM lc1975 wrote: Thank you everyone for the info.  I am happy to say that i was able to move the mri date up to tuesday!  :)  4 days early.  My follow up is for friday so at least I don't have to wait an extra weekend for the results.

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2011 03:58AM lc1975 wrote: Thank you mommyalways!  This is nice to hear.  I am not used to feeling vurnerable and i do.  I don't convey this to the people that surround me because I have always been the "strong" one, the "suck it up and move forward" type of woman.  I Hope that your new unknown findings turn out well.  Thank you again for your insight about the people here....it helps to know that there is such great support and understanding out there!
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2011 11:10PM lc1975 wrote: AJ, Thank you.  I am happy to say that I was able to move my MRI up to Tuesday...YAY!  and my follow up will be on friday so at least I won't have to wait an extra weekend.  I also was told by the radiologist that I have the densest breast that she has seen...:/
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2011 02:16PM lc1975 wrote: Bjm1328, That is good news! Yay!  I also got the no cancer cells, still atypical cells but no cancer.  They are still unsure what it is.  The final pathology report will be in today and my BS said that he will call be on Monday.  It is niuce to relax a little huh? :)  I am so happy to hear that we both got a similar report.  I hope that you had a great Thanksgiving!  We do have a lot to be thankful for! Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2011 03:13AM lc1975 wrote: Hi Wendyspet, he did the core biopsy as a less invasive route. .... at least for now. He said that he doesn't want to take out the area and leave it deformed if he doesnt have to since it would be a large chuck of my breast ( I am a b cup so the area is small to begin with lol).  So I have the MRI to look forward to and then another biopsy to follow.....I do report any change that I notice to him and I am beginning to know myself VERY well.  I don't think that I have ever been felt up so much in my life....;)  I am trying to keep in mind that 80% are benign.  Thank you for your good luck wishes :)
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2011 12:02AM - edited Nov 1, 2011 12:03AM by lc1975 Everyone is entitled to their opinions. I appriciate all kinds of input. I decided to join this site to hear opinions, stories, experiences....all of it. Unfortunatley I don't know what my lump is but I feel that the more that I know the better off I am. Knowledge is power. Better to be informed and prepared with others experience in the back of your mind than to be blind to it all and have it be a shock. As I had previously written, I have been reading this site for over a month now and I too have been awed and inspired and i am amazed at the compassion and support that strangers have in their hearts for each other.
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2011 12:46AM lc1975 wrote: Ugh....I have been trying to keep busy to keep my mind off of everything (even painted my kitchen cabinets) and I thought that I was doing well......until I realized yesterday that I completly flaked and missed my twins annual check-up (mind you that I knew the night before).  I feel awful but am realizing that these past 2 months without an answer are really taking a toll on me.  I want to cry but I can't, there is no time.  I feel like I am spacing out all over the place and what was part of my daily routines are now a struggle to remember what I have to do.  Typically how long have all of you waited to KNOW what your diagnosis is?
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2011 04:13AM - edited Nov 15, 2011 04:14AM by lc1975 Good luck tomorrow bjm1328!  We kind of get to do it together then :)  I will think of you (during the time that I am lucid...lol)  I am also having the wire guided.  I am sending positive thoughts your way too.  In a way the kids prevent me from thinking too much about it.  Thank you everyone for your info and support :)
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2011 07:51AM lc1975 wrote: dragonfly55, I am glad that the Dr's are not just shrugging this off.  That does make me feel a little better.  I just with that they had more of an answer.  Hopefully by Friday they will.  MRI is Tuesday!  Painted more cabinets today.  We are having family movie nigt in a few....with hot cocoa...then tea later ;)  I have been trying very hard to not "think" been doing pretty well. (except for when i am getting flaky) I have noticed that this site is very informative so when I do have a question about something I look it up.  It is great to talk to women that KNOW what you are going through.  Thank you so much for responding.  Sometime even just touching base with women that have been or are going through a similar situation helps.
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2011 03:56AM lc1975 wrote: Here is my update:  The MRI showed a deep mass (the one that we have been looking at) lit up.  The BS and the radiologist said that they are worried and that because of the difficulty with the core biopsy (getting through because of the density of my breasts)  the only way that they believe to get a true answer is through a surgical biopsy.  So, Tuesday (48 hours) I am scheduled.  I should have an answer by the end of the week.
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2011 12:54PM lc1975 wrote: bjm1328, I am glad to hear that you are home and on the mend.  I crashed hard on percs yesterday(had a tough time sleeping the night before)  Today I am TRYING to take it easy but I can't seem to "rest" well.  So I am doing lite chores :)  I had the incisional biopsy and they took a couple of good chunks from what I hear.  I will find out at my appointment on Wednesday...ugh....more waiting.  I didn't have a tube in my throat but I was shivering coming out of anestheia so they gave me demerol....twice since the first shot didn't stop me.  Underneath my jaw hurts from chattering my teeth, i think.  I hope that you are doing well today.  Thanks for your support as well.  If you want to chat some more feel free to pm me.  ttys LC
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: lc1975 wrote: Hi everybody!  I am new here and have been reading from this site for about a month and a half now.  I have been hesitant to sign up in case i "jinx" myself (which i know is foolish).  On September 14th I was lying on the couch, had an itch and found my first lump.  I shot up and went into the bathroom to investigate it further.  My first reaction was tears (I had lost my mother at age 7 and presently have a 7 year old and 6 year old twins)  My first thought was that I can't leave my children.  Once I pulled myself together I came out and told my husband and we agreed that I will call in the morning for an appointment. September 19th I had my appointment and they said nothing but they wanted me to go for a mammo and US.  September 27th I had the mammo and US.  The US tech spoke to the radiologist and they said that it was just a cyst.  On October 4th I had a follow up with my breast specialist and he tried a blind aspiration...no fluid....just cells.  He sent them out for testing.  On October 17th I had my annual appointment with my obgyn and he had the results which were indicative of fibroadenoma and he suggested that I google it.  I did.  I was ok with that and was feeling ok about it...relieved...I had an answer.  .......i thought.  October 20th came.  I had another appointment with the breast specialist.  I went in feeling good.  He informed me that when he tried to aspirate he may have hit a fibroadenoma however THAT was not the lump that we are looking at and he is not comfortable with just letting it go (which is a good trait in a doctor) so he wanted me to have a US guided core biopsy done, which I had on October 26th.  They took about 5 samples.  Apparently I have VERY dense breasts because it wasn't easy to get to the lump.  Then they placed a chip in my breast (for a marker) and gave me another mammo to locate the chip.   I met with the specialist on the 27th and he told me that some of the cells came back normal and some came back atypical so the Pathologist sent them out for further testing.  I did feel better that he commented on how the lump looked different on this US than the last....I had mentioned that the lump felt bigger or more irregular and that it wasn't just my mind playing tricks on me.  He also informed me that he and the radiologist agreed that they want another biopsy done but that an MRI first would help them get a better idea of where in the lump to target.  So I have an MRI scheduled for November 11th. I think that if I KNEW the answer even if it isn't the one that I want that I would be less stressed.....the worst part is not knowing.... But they are cautiously optimistic... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2011 02:35AM lc1975 wrote: Thank you Cookie Monster. I am looking forward to an answer instead of stress headaches and fatigue from stress. I don't want to worry people around me so I put my brave face on and try to convince myself not to worry until I have a reason to....unfortunatley it is easier said than done. I have been reading the dense breast disscussions here too and I am choking up again especially since the radiologist told me that she has never seen such dense breasts! :/
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2011 04:35AM lc1975 wrote: Thank you beacon800.  What worries me is the atypical cells that they found near the lump.  I really didn't see them get the needle into the lump (because my tissue is so dense it made it very hard to get to it) so the samples that they did get were near it not in it.  I feel like I am in limbo....  I have been sleeping, more than normal actually, must be my escape.  I have noticed that I am more sensitive to "noise"  with 3 kids that is tough to escape so i think that is why I am so tired too....trying NOT to take it out on them and trying to tune them out.  ugh.....hopefully i will have an answer in a few weeks.  Thanks again :)
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2011 11:14PM lc1975 wrote: Wow!  Barb1328, It sounds like you have been through alot.  So it has been awhile with no answers for you too.  I hope that they find your answer soon, for peace of mind.  Good luck on the 15th.  They also found Atypical cells from my biopsy.  Only 2 days left until my MRI!  I hope that we both get answers soon.
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2011 04:12AM lc1975 wrote: Thank you ladies :)  I survived my first MRI ever!  It was interesting to say the least.  Now for the dreaded waiting game....I know it is just a few days but Friday will not be able to come quick enough!
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2012 08:33PM lc1975 wrote: Leaf and bjm1328.  thank you for your responses.  I just received them. I haven't been on this site since....until today.   I hope that you are all doing well.  Leaf, ok.  Here it is.  I found a lump 11 months ago.  I went for all sorts of testing.  I have dense breasts and ended up with an MRI and a lumpectomy.  My pathology report states that I have....get ready... Florid fibrocystic changes with usual type ductal hyperplasia and extensive sclerosing adenosis.  Some areas of the adenosis are associated with myxoid change in the breast stroma.  Focal papillomatosis and apocrine metaplasia with cyst formation are also present.  This lesion is consistent with sclerosing adenosis with foci of intraductal papilloma with secondary sclerosis and entrapment of epithelial elements of the papilloma.  That was in the first sample.  Sample B states there is florid fibrocystic change with extensive sclerosing adenosis, papillomatosis and usual type ductal hyperplasia also evidence of a duct rupture as well as apocrine metaplasia with focal cyst formation.  6 months ago I has another mammo and ultrasound (dense breasts really doesnt show anything)  I just had another MRI on Monday and friday the doctor informed me that there was an area that lit up in the same place as the lumpectomy.  He said that it was small maybe about 6 mm and that it could just be scar tissue and that we will schedule another MRI for february.  I have mixed feelings about all of this.
Posts.Title: The worst part is not knowing... lc1975 awb
